name: Crowne Plaza Leeds

reviews.text: Chose this hotel to take my two grandsons, aged 7 and 5, on an overnight break. Room was lovely, spacious and clean with verything we needed. Breakfast was fabulous and the staff were helpful and kind and child friendly. Which is more than I can say for the dinner in the restaurant. My 5 yr old chose pizza from the child menu. It was two triangles of bread with raw beef tomoato coverd in melted cheese. He said "This isn't a pizza grandma!" Too true. My duck was inedible- like shoe leather and the second attempt was not much better. In fairnss I was not charged for the dinner and the waitress was aplogetic and somewhat embarrased. The pool was great and the kids had a ball. Shame the dinner spoiled things for us.
reviews.title: Good in parts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night stay 3rd-5th November, took advantage of a BBE meal deal which limited us to the set menu on the evenings, but each section had 6 or more choices. The evening food was top quality, cooked and presented to perfection, on each of the 3 courses, making this 'more than food' taking it to excellent cuisine, a BIG congratulations to the chefs and to Adam the restaurant manager.
reviews.title: Excellent Cuisine

reviews.text: Breakfast is self service with plenty of choice and is of a good standard.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: Our stay was also made that little bit extra special by Andrew on reception, who welcomed us to the hotel and along with the other staff members my birthday that litle bit more special.
reviews.title: Great hotel 5 minute walk from train station

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night on a business trip on 29th October. The room was plenty large enough and comfortable and quiet and I did sleep well.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was fine - not cheap but it had a swimming pool which was of an adequate size. Our bedroom and the whole of the floor smelt strongly of new carpet and fluff from the carpet stuck to everything. The room itself was fine. In fact the word "fine" and "adequate" keep springing to mind as suitable adjectives for most of the hotel. Location was quite good. I have to say the staff were very good - a credit to the hotel. Breakfast was disappointing and the dining room was crammed between 09:30 am and 10:30 am. The food was not very good and they kept running out of things. What really let the stay down was the small, old fashioned bathroom. It really was not acceptable in a hotel of this price. The receptionist explained they were redecordating the bedrooms and laying new carpets first as this was easier than replacing the bathrooms. Believe me, they need to replace the bathrooms. Overall I much prefer Bewleys but they don't have a pool. The car parking is extortionate.
reviews.title: Dreadful bathroom

reviews.text: For a Leeds City Centre Hotel you can't beat it. Not the cheapest but efficient with fantastic rooms - not dissimilar to the Leeds Marriott.What makes the Crowne Plaze is that it is in a quiet side of town, has large rooms and good staff.Breakfast now starts at 6.30 am which is excellent. Car park is a tad pricey at £10.00 per night. Breakfast good as is evening meal.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, efficient staff

reviews.text: Great location, only 5 minutes from train station and shops.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely atmosphere. Staff very friendly.
reviews.title: ok but not cheap

likes.disliked: — limited restaurant choice slightly expensive altogether

reviews.text: rooms very comfortable, stayed on 5th floor, very quiet.
reviews.title: Characterless business hotel

reviews.text: This is a very utilitarian accommodation experience! Mainly, it's like every other Crowne Plaza or its ilk you've ever stayed in your life.
reviews.title: Good for overnight business folk.

reviews.text: Distinctive features of this one are:
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.text: - it's location on the fringe of the city centre in an industrial park
reviews.title: A great hotel and staff so helpful

likes.liked: — The size of the family room, having two double beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - it's cranky staff
reviews.title: very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large and clean. I can't remember anything about the bathroom, which means it must have been fine.
reviews.title: Loved the Crowne Plaza

reviews.text: I thought this hotel was closer to the train station that it actually was - not that it was far but carrying a heavy bag made it seem further!
reviews.title: A little bit far out of the centre but good hotel

likes.disliked: — the buffet ran out of lemon tart too quickly!

reviews.text: The staff were really friendly, the bedroom was large and comfortable with a great view over the ring road (well at night it was nice anyway!) looking towards Kirkstall. There was a slightly random large desk in the room which jutted in towards the bed and the TV was in a cupboard (an irrational pet hate of mine!)
reviews.title: Crowne Plaze Leeds

likes.liked: — Quality of food and dirty mouldy shower and pool area

reviews.text: The conference rooms were large and generally good and the food was really tasty.
reviews.title: Not great!

reviews.text: Half term break with teenage children. Staff were excellent ... reception staff friendly and helpful. Food in the restaurant was very poor ... not acceptable even for a large chain hotel. ( however front of house staff were excellent ) Facilities were good but the swimming pool and shower area are in desperate need of immediate attention. About 10 minutes walk along a busy road from the centre of Leeds. 5 mins drive to cinema and restaurant complex .Complaints about Parking Charge on the web site but this is clearly shown on tariffs and in reception... where else would you park your car in Leeds city centre All in all ok .
reviews.title: Acceptable for a Friday Night out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Leeds has some very nice and original hotels, but the Crowne Plaza is not one of them. Its OK, but generally rather drab and smells a bit musty. Considering the price you can do a lot better.
reviews.title: Good Value

likes.liked: — Value for money and a nice comfy bed with blackout curtains
likes.disliked: — Some staff and lack of atmosphere

reviews.text: Lovely hotel - a typical Crowne Plaza really. We had meetings nearby so colleagues from our other office came to stay. Service was excellent, the food menus were good (tad pricey but typical hotels i guess). Parking okay. Its a shame its not a little bit nearer to the centre. Now dont get me wrong, its not miles away, its only a short walk, but when the weather is grim (which it is too often!) you cant just pop out for some shopping. Bit of a minor thing really. Staff excellent and will return. x
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: I'm a historical traditional Crowne Plaza visitor and having not stayed in one for a while I took the chance. I was reassured that the same familiar standard had been maintained in the newer build Crowne Plaza Hotel that Leeds has.
reviews.title: Is the Crowne still on top?

reviews.text: Despite not being right in the centre of town, I had chosen to dine in due to work commitments. Unfortunately the main restaurant was full (good sign) mostly due to one single touring party, so the Hd Waiter suggested using the bar upstairs which i did. Fortunately they could serve the restaurant menu in the bar. So scallops and so on duly ordered. Quick service I might add.
reviews.title: Great Service - Certain Parts Could Do With Refurbishment

reviews.text: The food I chose (scallops followed by Liver) unfortunately was cooked more than of asked / expected but was still okay.
reviews.title: Good deal,fantastic staff

reviews.text: The room inc a slight upgrade due to long standing membership was large and very comfortable!
reviews.title: Super

reviews.text: Mrs Localshopper and friends had a girls shopping weekend staying at the Crowne Plaza. Got an excellent rate by paying in advance. Looked after extremely well by the staff - nothing was too much trouble. Special mention for Emma & Andrew who couldn't possibly have done any more to help.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza with 3 very excitable 10 year old girls. Got an extremely good deal on the price by booking and paying in advance. Hotel is within walking distance of the shops and has plenty of car parking spaces available.
reviews.title: Fantastic family friendly hotel

reviews.text: The staff were fantastic and made the girls feel very welcome and just as important as the adult guests.
reviews.title: Excellent value and reasonably central location.

reviews.text: The room was beautiful with lots of little extras such as lavender scents and pillow chocolates that added to the excitement and the food was perfect with the kids eat free deal being very easy on the pocket.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay in Leeds

reviews.text: The pool area with jacuzzi, steam and sauna also raised a lot of smiles.
reviews.title: Good stay and location

reviews.text: Stayed early November to meet some clients in Leeds having stayed many times at this hotel before. Hotel felt very quiet and car park was empty compared to previous stays.Had room service dinner, quality was good and delivered in acceptable time. My biggest gripe was the cost for one night including parking was simply too high especially in the current climate. £13 to park and £3.50 to have someone deliver a meal that cost £20 to my room is in my opinion excessive...I was aware of the cost but still think its excessive.
reviews.title: A bit pricey...

reviews.text: Usually I would eat in town as there are plenty of excellent restaurants but time was against me.
reviews.title: Great for a family mini-break

reviews.text: I would now look at alternatives despite being a platinum member of PClub as I feel that there are cheaper, just as high quality options available.
reviews.title: Ideal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to treat my children to an overnight stay as it was the German Christmas Market in Leeds and we wanted to try a restaurant we had heard about. I picked this hotel as children were free and there was a pool. The hotel was great, we expected to have to pay for parking but as it turns out we didn't which was a bonus. The staff were friendly and the breakfast excellent - perhaps too much choice as my two boys could not make their minds up.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: Two small flaws though, firstly the family room was not very big and there certainly was nowhere for adults to sit and relax after the children were in bed. This is a common fault in family rooms though.
reviews.title: Large rooms, great location and value for money

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for business purposes, and was involved in a very busy few days here. My room was good and well equipped for my purposes with drink making facilities/ iron and hairdryer. The bathroom was complete with shower and bath, well lit and pleasant. The room was similarly pleasant with broadband facilities and was spacious.
reviews.title: Just OK

likes.liked: — Location- 5 minutes away from the train station
likes.disliked: — Food and the bar prices which were obscene.

reviews.text: The food at this hotel was not great. I was here for two nights and this included having three lunches at the hotel. The food was repetitive in that the evening meal was practically identical to the lunch options, which was not ideal as there were four options to chose from, as well as a limited salad bar. The bar was similarly disappointing in that the wine and drink list was extremely limited, and prices were disgraceful. I think it's fair to say that to charge £6.50 for a 250ml glass of Ernst and Julio Gallo White Grenache is extortionate.
reviews.title: A little basic for a four star

likes.disliked: — No hair dryer or tea and coffe making facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had I only needed to stay here a night and not have to have lunch here, it wouldn't have ben too bad. That said, the disgraceful bar prices, thus, a blatant expolitation of guests would put me off ever considering a Crowne Plaza hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Tired Rooms - Poorly Managed

likes.liked: — Location to centre of Leeds, close to train station
likes.disliked: — Poorly run, having to chase for things that should have been provided

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Different websites advertise this hotel as 4 stars others as 3. No tea and coffee in rooms, no hairdryer. However did receive an upgrade on arrival from double to twin double. Breakfast very expensive at £15.95 but there is a Starbucks opposite. Good location for shopping and the railway station.
reviews.title: Good location, but needs some TLC

reviews.text: Stayed weekend 2 nights, booked a deluxe room (612) on their web site 2 4 1 great value but, although this hotel is very well located for Leeds central and loads of pubs & places to eat and nightlife. The hotel itself appears poorly managed.
reviews.title: No Way a Crowne Plaza

description: Modern Hotel located in downtown area, 1/4 mile from Leeds train station.
